00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantMethodReportListener.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Tue Mar 28 10:04:33 2006
00026  *
00027  * @brief Listens for reporting signals from QuantMethod and then passes
00028  * them off to another coordinating object. This is needed as the analysis
00029  * stream "owns" the reporters and will destroy them when the stream is
00030  * destroyed. This is a problem if you want multiple analysis streams
00031  * reporting into the same thing.
00032  */
00033 
00034 //
00035 #include "chipstream/QuantMethodReportListener.h"
00036 
00037 QuantMethodReportListener::QuantMethodReportListener()
00038 {}
00039 
00040 QuantMethodReportListener::~QuantMethodReportListener()
00041 {}
00042 
00043 bool QuantMethodReportListener::prepare(QuantMethod &qMethod, const IntensityMart &iMart) {
00044   bool result = true;
00045   for(int i=0; i<m_Listeners.size(); i++)
00046     result = result && m_Listeners[i]->prepare(qMethod, iMart);
00047   return result;
00048 }
00049 
00050 bool QuantMethodReportListener::report(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, 
00051                                        QuantMethod &qMethod,
00052                                        const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00053                                        std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00054                                        PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) { 
00055   bool result = true;
00056   for(int i=0; i<m_Listeners.size(); i++)
00057     result = result && m_Listeners[i]->report(psGroup, qMethod, iMart, iTrans, pmAdjust);
00058   return result;
00059 }
00060 
00061 bool QuantMethodReportListener::reportFailure(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, 
00062                                               QuantMethod &qMethod,
00063                                               const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00064                                               std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00065                                               PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) { 
00066   bool result = true;
00067   for(int i=0; i<m_Listeners.size(); i++)
00068     result = result && m_Listeners[i]->reportFailure(psGroup, qMethod, iMart, iTrans, pmAdjust);
00069   return result;
00070 }
00071 
00072 bool QuantMethodReportListener::finish(QuantMethod &qMethod) {
00073   bool result = true;
00074   for(int i=0; i<m_Listeners.size(); i++)
00075     result = result && m_Listeners[i]->finish(qMethod);
00076   return result;
00077 }

00111 void QuantMethodReportListener::registerListener(QuantMethodReport *listener) {
00112   m_Listeners.push_back(listener);
00113 }
